霸.definition: hegemon; tyrant; lord; feudal chief; to rule by force; to usurp; (in modern advertising) master

霸主.definition: a powerful chief of the princes of the Spring and Autumn Period (770-476 BC); overlord; hegemon

霸佔.definition: to occupy by force; to seize; to dominate

霸妻.definition: to use one's power and influence to take another man's wife for oneself

霸州市.definition: Bazhou, county-level city in Langfang 廊坊市[Lang2fang2 Shi4], Hebei

霸座.definition: to willfully occupy sb else's seat

霸業.definition: the task of establishing and maintaining hegemony

霸榜.definition: to dominate a chart; to top a ranking

霸機.definition: (of passengers) to stage a sit-in after the plane has landed (as a protest against bad service etc) (Tw)

霸氣.definition: imperious; aggressive; assertive; dictatorial manner; boldness (CL:股[gu3])

霸王之道.definition: the Way of the Hegemon; despotic rule; abbr. to 霸道

霸王別姬.definition: The Conqueror Bids Farewell to His Favorite Concubine (tragic opera by Mei Lanfang 梅蘭芳|梅兰芳[Mei2 Lan2 fang1]); Farewell My Concubine (1993 film by Chen Kaige)

霸王硬上弓.definition: to force oneself upon sb (idiom); to rape

霸王鞭.definition: a rattle stick used in folk dancing; rattle stick dance

霸總.definition: handsome high-powered businessman (abbr. for 霸道總裁|霸道总裁[ba4 dao4 zong3 cai2])

霸道.definition: the Way of the Hegemon; abbr. for 霸王之道; despotic rule; rule by might; evil as opposed to the Way of the King 王道; overbearing; tyranny; (of liquor, medicine etc) strong; potent

霸道總裁.definition: handsome high-powered businessman (a type of character in an eponymous genre of romantic fiction who typically has a soft spot for a girl of lower social status)
